title: Dual-Boot System Deployment
author: Parmdeep Chhabra
summary: Log of partitioning a Windows drive and creating a Linux boot device with Rufus. Completed without data loss. Includes Linux installation and GRUB boot issue resolution from Grok AI voice consultation.
objectives: Install Ubuntu and configure GRUB for dual-boot.

execution_log.action: Opened Disk Management (diskmgmt.msc) with admin rights.
execution_log.details: Shrunk C: drive by 120GB for unallocated space.
Used Ubuntu ISO, GPT partition, UEFI target.
Set USB as priority; checked Secure Boot.
execution_log.result: System set to boot from USB.

execution_log.details: Booted Ubuntu installer, verified Windows partition.
Manual partitioning: /dev/sda8 (ext4, 100GB root), /dev/sda9 (swap, 16GB), /dev/sda10 (ext4, 4GB /home). Mounted EFI (/dev/sda1) at /boot/efi.
execution_log.result: Partitions set. GRUB missed Windows; fixed with os-prober.
GRUB installed. Only Ubuntu booted; no dual-boot menu. Secure Boot issue suspected.

execution_log.action: Fixed boot issue via live USB (Grok guidance).
execution_log.details: Mounted partitions: `sudo mount /dev/sda8 /mnt`, `sudo mount /dev/sda1 /mnt/boot/efi`, `sudo mount --bind /dev /mnt/dev`. Chroot: `sudo chroot /mnt`, ran `sudo update-grub`, `sudo grub-install /dev/sda`.
execution_log.result: GRUB fixed; Windows EFI restored. Dual-boot menu appeared.

execution_log.details: Tested Windows (12s boot) and Ubuntu (18s boot).

lessons_learned: Check GPT/MBR compatibility before USB creation.
Mount EFI partition in UEFI setups for GRUB.
Fix missing dual-boot menu with live USB chroot: mount root/EFI, bind /dev/proc/sys, chroot, run `update-grub`, `grub-install`.
Disable Secure Boot during GRUB fixes; re-enable after.
remarks: Completed in 125 minutes due to GRUB issues. Grok voice consultation resolved problems in under 10 minutes. Operator confident in Linux setup.
